title: Sam Burgess seen for the first time since shock AVO drama following 'second split' from wife Phoebe
text:
Sam Burgess has been seen out and about for the first time since news broke that his father-in-law, Mitchell Hooke, took out an AVO against him on Saturday.

The 30-year-old appeared downcast as he visited a medical centre in Redfern, Sydney.

The footballer wore a stern expression as he strode down the street to his appointment.

Stepping out: On Tuesday, Sam Burgess (pictured) appeared downcast as he was seen for the first time since shock AVO drama following 'second split' from wife Phoebe Burgess

He appeared to liven up at one stage, giving a thumbs up sign to someone across the road.

Sam wore a black shirt that fitted to his muscular frame as he strode down the road, his head slightly bowed.

He added a pair of grey Nike shorts, and wore white slides upon his otherwise bare feet.

A pair of aviator sunglasses hid his famous features and the footballer also wore a chunky watch.

Sam made a quick trip to the medical centre, dashing across the road from his white car.

He then made an equally quick exit as he left the centre, appearing to also visit a nearby chemist.

Low-key: He added a pair of grey Nike shorts to the casual ensemble

Cheering up: He appeared to liven up at one stage, giving a thumbs up sign to someone he spotted

Errands: Sam made a quick trip to the medical centre, dashing across the road

NRL star Sam Burgess shared a smiling selfie doting on his two children on Saturday afternoon, amid reports he 'split' from wife Phoebe Burgess several weeks ago.

Following the split, Phoebe has moved back in with her parents at their estate in Bowral, 117km south of Sydney.

It was at the Bowral property where Sam was allegedly involved in an argument with his father-in-law, Mitchell Hooke, on Saturday.

Moving on: Following the reported 'split' his wife Phoebe has moved back in with her parents at their estate in Bowral, 117km south of Sydney

Details: Mr Hooke reportedly asked Sam to leave the family's three hectare Glenquarry farm, which Sam did, but police were called at about 5pm

Drama: Officers filed an interim apprehended violence order (AVO) against Sam and, according to court documents, he is now barred from coming close to the home

Mr Hooke reportedly asked Sam to leave the family's three hectare Glenquarry farm, which Sam did, but police were called at about 5pm.

Officers filed an interim apprehended violence order (AVO) against Sam and, according to court documents, he is now barred from coming close to the home.

Sam is also banned from coming within 1km of any other place where Mr Hooke, a retired mining executive, lives or works.

The English sportsman was also hit with standard AVO conditions which prevent him from stalking, intimidating or assaulting Phoebe's father.

Banned: Sam is also banned from coming within 1km of any other place where Mr Hooke, a retired mining executive, lives or works

Conditions: The English sportsman was also hit with standard AVO conditions which prevent him from stalking, intimidating or assaulting Phoebe's father. A NSW Police spokeswoman told Daily Mail Australia police are investigating and 'there are no reports of any injuries'

A NSW Police spokeswoman told Daily Mail Australia police are investigating and 'there are no reports of any injuries.'

Sam is due before Moss Vale Local Court on November 6, where a magistrate could confirm the AVO or dismiss it in its entirety.

There is no suggestion Sam did anything wrong by visiting the property. Phoebe was not at the farm during Sam's visit.

The Burgesses married in December 2015 in a lavish ceremony at the same southern highlands estate where Sam clashed with his father-in-law over the weekend.

It's over! Sam and Phoebe Burgess split for a second time 'several weeks ago', after previously separating in December and reconciling in April
